description: To provide the public with all relevent information regarding the outbreak, the Surinamese government created a website for public access. The website is accessible by any member of the public, but can only be edited by members of the Corona emergency response team, and associated doctors and researchers.

The Ministry of Social Affairs and Housing announced that in Suriname "from March 16 all government and private crèches and preschools are closed. An exception is made with regard to nurseries that are managed by a hospital."

In Suriname "the 'Exceptional Condition Act COVID-19' was passed unanimously on April 7 after a marathon meeting in The National Assembly (DNA)."
In Suriname, the 'Exceptional Condition Act COVID-19' will last from April 7 to July 7.

description: In Suriname, the Ministry of Finance starts from the May 18 with payment of social support from the COVID-19 Emergency Fund. This fund is for people who have a reduced or no income as a result of the COVID-19 crisis. The fund is intended to alleviate the acute distress of the least wealthy and groups hardest hit by the COVID-19 crisis.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: In Suriname, from April 30 to May 10, through the whole country there will be more controle from the Police and the National Army
type_text: They want to more police and military on the street to make sure that everybody follows the rules that the government set up to prevent the spread of covid 19. So the government, together with the national military and the police, decided to put more controlling forces on the street.

description: In Suriname, on the 13th of March, The Ministry of Trade, Industry and Tourism (HI&T) calls on the entire Surinamese community not to hoard food for fear of the corona virus.

On March 19, the Ministry of Health of Suriname, stated that awareness of COVID-19 has been increased through an ongoing communication campaign through various media channels as well as the BOG Facebook page.

On 24 March, it was announced that  the Surinamese ministry and a focal point of the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO), led by the Director of Health, have assembled the National Public Health Response team (response team) to develop strategies to inform the general public and individuals entering the country about preventive actions to prevent the spread the Coronavirus.
On April 29, it was emphasized by Surinamese authorities that citizens who shelter persons who have illegally entered Suriname are getting punished.

description: In Suriname, it was announced on the 9th of May that from the 11th of May, the National COVID-19 Management team will have conversations with several organizations (non essential businesses, e.g. horeca, sportcentra, religious organizations, entertainment industry and public transport) about the reopening of these organizations. The COVID-19 Management team will hold talks with representatives of these sectors to consider how to move to standardization.
type_sub_cat: Gathering information related to COVID-19 from the public

description: On March 15, Surinamese residents, who arrive back in Suriname, will be  required to spend 14 days in a government quarantine centre.

description: In Suriname, from March 28, no home quarantine is allowed after someone has been abroad, only government quarantine.

description: In Suriname, "from the 6th of April, the team of the 'Bureau voor Openbare Gezondheidszorg' (BOG) will personally visit all the people who are in quarantine on the 15th day of their quarantine to check if they're allowed to stop with quarantine".

description: Suriname "is enforcing a two-week government quarantine or home quarantine under surveillance of the government on all passengers after the 15th of March". On April 16, the Minister of Health said violators of government quarantine could be detained for six months.

description: In Suriname, passengers returning from the Netherlands and Curacao, are no longer required to be quaranted at home for 14 days, but only if they have stayed in the Netherlands or in Curacao for 14 days before returning to Suriname. Otherwise home quarantine is enforced.
